movie.title: Mesrine: Public Enemy #1
movie.plot: The story of Jacques Mesrine, France's public enemy No. 1 during the 1970s. After nearly two decades of legendary criminal feats -- from multiple bank robberies and to prison breaks -- Mesrine was gunned down by the French police in Paris.

movie.title: Mandela: Long Walk to Freedom
movie.plot: A chronicle of Nelson Mandela's life journey from his childhood in a rural village through to his inauguration as the first democratically elected president of South Africa.
movie.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 11 wins & 32 nominations.

studios.title: Industrial Development Corporation of South Africa

events.title: Nelson Mandela is freed from prison

movie.title: Invictus
movie.plot: Newly elected President Nelson Mandela knows his nation remains racially and economically divided in the wake of apartheid. Believing he can bring his people together through the universal language of sport, Mandela rallies South Africa's rugby team as they make their historic run to the 1995 Rugby World Cup Championship match.
movie.awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 12 wins & 35 nominations.

events.title: Joel finds out that Clementine has had her memories of him erased

movie.title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
movie.plot: Joel Barish, heartbroken that his girlfriend underwent a procedure to erase him from her memory, decides to do the same. However, as he watches his memories of her fade away, he realises that he still loves her, and may be too late to correct his mistake.

events.title: Dick Cheney accidentally shoots Harry Whittington

movie.title: Vice
movie.plot: George W. Bush picks Dick Cheney, the CEO of Halliburton Co., to be his Republican running mate in the 2000 presidential election. No stranger to politics, Cheney's impressive résumé includes stints as White House chief of staff, House Minority Whip and defense secretary. When Bush wins by a narrow margin, Cheney begins to use his newfound power to help reshape the country and the world.
